Package express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime

package express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime
Myra Codec Runtime - Core classes for high-performance message encoding and decoding.

Thread Safety Summary

Class Thread-Safe? Notes
EncoderConfig ✅ Yes Immutable. Share freely.
MessageEncoder ❌ No Use one per thread (or ThreadLocal).
PooledSegment ❌ No Single-owner until closed.
MessageHeader ❌ No Flyweight pattern, reuse via wrap().
RepeatingGroupIterator ❌ No Flyweight pattern, reuse via wrap().
RepeatingGroupBuilder ❌ No Single-threaded builder pattern.
VariableSizeRepeatingGroupIterator ❌ No Flyweight pattern, reuse via wrap().
VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder ❌ No Single-threaded builder pattern.

Recommended Patterns

High-Throughput Encoding (Multiple Threads)

// Shared across all threads (thread-safe pool)
MemorySegmentPool pool = new LockFreeBufferPool(64 * 1024, 16);
EncoderConfig config = EncoderConfig.HIGH_PERFORMANCE;

// Per-thread encoder
ThreadLocal<MessageEncoder> encoderLocal = ThreadLocal.withInitial(
    () -> new MessageEncoder(pool, config));

// In each thread:
MessageEncoder encoder = encoderLocal.get();
MemorySegment segment = encoder.acquire(1024);
// ... encode ...

Decoding with Flyweight Reuse

// Per-thread flyweights
MessageHeader header = new MessageHeader();
MyMessageFlyweight message = new MyMessageFlyweight();

// Process multiple messages in a loop
while (hasMoreData()) {
    header.wrap(segment, offset);
    message.wrap(segment, offset + MessageHeader.HEADER_SIZE);
    process(message);
    offset += header.getFrameLength();
}

Generated Builders and Flyweights

All generated message flyweights and builders follow the same thread safety rules:

  • Flyweights: Not thread-safe, reuse via wrap(), zero allocation
  • Builders: Not thread-safe, use one per encoding operation

  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    EncoderConfig
    Configuration options for the Myra message encoder.
    EncoderConfig.Builder
    Builder for creating EncoderConfig instances.
    MessageEncoder
    Small helper for performing forward-only, single-pass message encoding with the standard Myra message header.
    PooledSegment
    An AutoCloseable wrapper for a MemorySegment that automatically releases the segment back to its pool when used in a try-with-resources block.
